intro: Atylosia crassa, commonly known as the broadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a robust, upright stem with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Atylosia crassa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open plains.
